sentences.expr:
Source and target images  $(I^{s},I^{t})$  are passed through an alignment network
that estimates the geometric transformation  $g$
sentences.label: definition

sentences.expr:
Then, the soft-inlier count is computed (in green) by first finding the inlier region  $m$ 
in agreement with  $g$ , and then summing up the pairwise matching scores  $s$  inside this
area of the discretized matches space
sentences.label: usecase

sentences.expr: The final stage of the alignment network consists of estimating the parameters of a geometric transformation  $g$  given the match scores  $s$
sentences.label: definition

sentences.expr: The estimated transformation parameters  $g$  are used to define the 2-D warping  $\mathcal{T}_{g}$ :
sentences.label: definition

sentences.expr:
We propose the  soft-inlier count  used to automatically evaluate the
estimated geometric transformation  $g$
sentences.label: usecase

sentences.expr:
Making an effort to maximize this count provides the weak-supervisory signal required
to train the alignment network, avoiding the need for
expensive manual annotations for  $g$
sentences.label: none

sentences.expr:
1 ), and
matches are deemed to be inliers if they fit the estimated geometric transformation  $g$
sentences.label: definition

sentences.expr:
where  $\mathcal{T}_{g}(k,l)$  are the estimated coordinates of
target image’s point  $(k,l)$  in the source image according to the
geometric transformation  $g$ ;
 $\text{d}\big{(}(i,j),\mathcal{T}_{g}(k,l)\big{)}$  is the reprojection error
as it measures how aligned is the point  $(i,j)$  in the source image,
with the projection of the target image point  $(k,l)$  into the source image
sentences.label: usecase

sentences.expr: The proposed soft-inlier count  $c$  is differentiable with respect to the transformation parameters  $g$  as long as the geometric transformation  $\mathcal{T}_{g}$  is differentiable  , which is the case for a range of standard geometric transformations such as 2D affine, homography or thin-plate spline transformations
sentences.label: usecase
